results.title: Trump Executive Nears Plea Deal With Manhattan Prosecutors

results.title: Over Two Million Infant Swings and Rockers Recalled After Baby’s Death
results.abstract: Hanging straps on certain MamaRoo swing and RockaRoo rocker models posed a risk of strangulation to crawling infants. The company is offering free strap fasteners to consumers.

results.title: Pain Doctor Who Sexually Assaulted Patients Found Dead at Rikers
results.abstract: Ricardo Cruciani’s death, just weeks after his conviction, was a suspected suicide. He was the 12th person to die this year in custody or shortly after release.

results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Glenn Thrush
results.title: Trump Lawyer Told Justice Dept. That Classified Material Had Been Returned
results.abstract: The lawyer signed a statement in June that all documents marked as classified and held in boxes in storage at Mar-a-Lago had been given back. The search at the former president’s home on Monday turned up more.

media.caption: An inventory of the material taken from Mar-a-Lago on Monday showed that F.B.I. agents seized 11 sets of documents with some type of confidential or secret marking on them.

results.title: Justice Dept. Objects to Releasing Affidavit Used to Search Trump’s Home
results.abstract: Prosecutors say its release would compromise the investigation into Donald J. Trump’s handling of secret documents after he left office. Now a judge must decide.

results.title: How Quitting a Job Changed My Work-Life Balance
results.abstract: We asked people who quit their jobs during the “Great Resignation” how it changed how they approach work. This is what they told us.

media.caption: Evelyn Lai worked 50 hours per week as a pediatric nurse practitioner at a community health clinic in Austin; she now has a less hectic schedule working at a hospital in Seattle.
